Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief and Lainy r, Thanks ever so much for the oncotype graph.  I''ve decidedvthat if intermediate, I'll opt for no chemo. If high, then decision made for me really.  I've read your bio Elaine, and I'm in the same situation as you were but my 20 mm tumour was 57 mm when removed plus a bit more as 2nd op was needed as margins weren't clear. Hence been upgraded to a 3. Good news is clear margins now & lymph nodes clear.  The wait for oncotype dx is awful, but hopefully get results this Thursday.  I've been sitting at home since surgery & between appts doing nothing, putting on weight, not exercising & feel tearful & miserable. Before this, I was travelling to work & back 4+ hrs each day, in a very stressful job & getting home about 8pm each night. A very busy life, now on hold hold waiting for results  from week to week. Can't focus on anything.  Also feel guilty that my situation isn't the same as others here, who are facing huge battles. I'm an all or nothing person, and am in limbo until I know my full treatment plan. I know it's radiotherapy & letrozole,  but hope not chemo too. I'm such a wimp! I read today about a new test called Endopredict,  not yet approved by NICE but available privately. It's supposed to give a more accurate prognosis & prediction score. I'm going to mention to my Oncologist on Thursday. Have you heard of it? My surgeon has been draining my underarm each week where nodes were taken for biopsy. It fills up quite quickly & is the size of an egg.  Does anyone know if this will eventually stop? Glad to hear you're having a fabulous break Elaine. Hope to follow suit as soon as I can plan. Thanks for listening xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Hi Lainy r I'm new here so I'm sorry if you've already updated everyone on your decision, but what was the outcome of your Oncotype dx test? I'm waiting for my results & I can't imagine how I'll be able to make a decision. I'm so glad I've found this forum, you're all amazing and it's so humbling to hear how women have overcome mountains.  I hope you're well and have time to reply. All the best, Ann-Marie x
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang, I agree with you. My husband has been working from home since my diagnosis,  and we are much closer than we were.  I'd  been working & travelling at least 13 / 14 hrs a day for the past 10 yrs  and when i have my "why me" moments, part of me wonders if this is a wake up call for me. I certainly value our relationship so much more, so for me this is a positive.

Posts.Title: Amazing support

Posts.Content: I can't offer any advice but I had mine drained three times, with about 100 - 150 mls fluid each time.  Then when I met my Oncologist,  he said don't drain it. That was three weeks ago, and my satsuma lump is still there,  but doesn't seen as big. I can live with it, but often sit with my arm raised so it doesn't press down. I won't be wearing any sleeveless dresses anytime soon  . Xx
Posts.Title: Lump under arm after op

Posts.Content: Hi Isinglass,  I think you're making a wise decision to take a step back if you can afford to xxx
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Enjoy! I'm pleased for you xx
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Hi Jane,  I don't know if this will reassure you but I  thought it might help. If you read my bio, I think our results were similar, except the size of our lumps differ.  I had private health care too, had the oncotype with a result of 11, which recommended that chemo wasn't  needed.   Two lumpectomies,  15 sessions of radiotherapy, 10 yrs Letrozole. Diagnosed Sept 2016. My Oncologist said I could have chemo if I wanted but as the Onco Dx result suggested it wasn't needed,  i.e. there would be no tangible benefit, I opted not to have it. Please don't get anxious. If you are worried,  perhaps speak to your Oncologist? All the best, x
Posts.Title: Anybody heard or used the Oncotype Dx test for deciding treatment...

Posts.Content: I agree. I was on HRT for TEN years, from 45 to 55 which is when I was diagnosed in Oct 2016.

Posts.Content: Hi, that's got me thinking. I've been on Letrozole for just 3 months but recently thought that my eye sight was slightly worse. I'm going to get checked out by an optician. Hopefully it's just my imagination xx

Posts.Title: Full Range of Breast Cancer Related Books To Read or Download

Posts.Content: Haha I've started eating Ben & Jerry's each night. I deserve it  xx
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Hi LondonLass, It's particularly embarrassing when I mix up the names of my two sons but they see the funny side.  On a serious note, I dread going back to work as I work in IT with some big companies.  I don't know how they'd react if I got tongue tied in meetings, whilst beaming with sweat from head to foot . I'm hoping the Disability at Work Act will save me, and I'll be reassigned to a back office role! To be honest,  they'll just have to deal with it. I'm not giving up my livelihood because of this beast. Bring it on! I can take anything on after this.  Before I cook my fish & chips, I'll just tell you that I've learned to photograph where I park my car in case I can't find it, he hehe.  So, back to TV, Who's going to win X Factor?  (just kidding). Xx
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: Hi LondonLass,  I agreee with you, hot sweats are evil, and I thought I'd seen the back of them with my lovely HRT. Having had 10 years without the blighters, they're back. Saw my Oncologist for first appt. three weeks ago & I took out my six months HRT supply & asked if I should still take them.  His face was a picture, he said "how did you manage to get these past a surgeon & two anaesthetists?". He grabbed them and said, you're never to take them again. At that point I'd had two surgeries in two weeks, having recently been diagnosed so it was all a whirlwind. Now of course I know that my cancer loves estrogen,  and I'm learning lots from you ladies.  I have a fan on throughout the night & windows open too.  My hot sweats come with a Brucie bonus called brain fuzz. The other day I took some recycling to the supermarket, got out and the  car rolled slowly forward. Oh my God,  I dived into the car and pressed the hand brake. Thank goodness it wasn't a steep incline.   I was also trying to explain how I like my eggs and the word just wouldn't come to me. I could see poached eggs but couldn't find the name.  It's happening more & more, maybe it's this roller  coaster I'm on! Should I be worried or try some mind puzzles to exercise my saggy brain Off to hairdressers this afternoon to give myself a bit of pampering to take my mind off the weight I've put on! Big love to everyone x
Posts.Title: NOT Pink and Fluffy! RETURNS....

Posts.Content: I'm glad this question was asked because I haven't had a bone scan either. It's a question I'll ask my Oncologist this Thursday. I'm taking Letrozole.

Posts.Content: Hi Tessiecat1, Thanks for your reply. I'm also ER+. I'm surprised my Oncologist hasn't mentioned this test but I'll find out and post an update. xx

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief I've written this info down to raise with Onco. I started menopause @45, started HRT until my Oncologist snatched my supply off me before I started RT a couple of months ago. I'm 55. I've got a recording of my mtg with him but can't listen to it but I'm sure DEXA wasn't mentioned. I really appreciate your advice xx
